task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 23°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the top of the building to estimate its height, so I should rotate the camera upward to view the roof while maintaining the current heading toward the building.
I need to see both the base and the top of the building to estimate its height; rotating down will reveal the ground level at the building's base for a complete vertical reference.
I need to reorient toward the building's direction (23°NE) to align my view with the target structure before estimating height.
I need to view the top of the building to measure its full height; rotating upward will reveal the roof while maintaining alignment with the building's direction.
I need to reorient to the building's direction (23°NE) since the current heading is 0°N, which is misaligned with the target structure.

I have aligned with the building (23°NE) and previously observed both the roof (via +30° pitch) and base (via -30° pitch), allowing height estimation using trigonometry with the apparent vertical angle and assumed distance.
